title: 2024 A/L exam resumes
byline: The 2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level examination which was temporarily suspended due to recent adverse weather conditions recommences today (Dec. 04).

title: Fair weather prevails across most areas; morning mist expected
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that several spells of showers will occur in Northern and Eastern provinces today (04).

title: South Korea’s President Yoon reverses martial law after lawmakers defy him
byline: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said on Wednesday he would lift a surprise martial law declaration he had imposed just hours before, backing down in a standoff with parliament which roundly rejected his attempt to ban political activity and censor the media.

title: National Procurement Commission probing e-passport tender issue, court told
byline: The Attorney General (AG) has informed the Court of Appeal that the National Procurement Commission of Sri Lanka is conducting an investigation into the method in which the previous government has granted the tender related to purchasing 5 million electronic passports for the Department of Immigration and Emigration.

title: Mill owners warn of looming rice shortage
byline: The All Ceylon Small and Medium Scale Mill Owners’ Association warns of a looming rice shortage if the government fails to import rice within the next two weeks.

title: Kelum Jayasumana granted bail
byline: Social activist Kelum Jayasumana who was arrested for sharing Mahaviru commemoration posts on social media has been granted bail.

title: MP Sujith Sanjay Perera refutes assault allegations by MP Archchuna Ramanathan
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) parliamentarian Sujith Sanjaya Perera has denied allegations of assault leveled against him by Jaffna District Independent MP Dr. Archchuna Ramanathan.

title: Legislation to recover stolen assets, deter money laundering & drug trafficking
byline: Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara stated that the Proceeds of Crime Bill, Rescue, Rehabilitation and Insolvency Bill and the amendments to the Audit Bill will be presented to the Parliament at the beginning of the next quarter.

title: ‘Plot to create division between North and South’: Public Security Minister on LTTE ‘Mahaviru’ celebration claims
byline: Minister Ananda Wijepala has alleges that photographs from the past  LTTE ‘Mahaviru’ celebrations that were held in other countries had been circulated on social media, to create the impression that similar events were taking place in the Northern Province of Sri Lanka under the current administration.

title: Ministry of Defense limits civilian firearm issuance to one per individual
byline: The Ministry of Defense has announced a new policy limiting the issuance of firearms for self-defence to only one per individual.

title: Stock of mobile phone accessories discovered at Boossa Prison Hospital
byline: A cache of mobile phone and electronic accessories has been discovered at the Boossa High-Security Prison during a search operation conducted by the Police Special Task Force (STF).

title: Millers agree to supply rice at controlled price to market
byline: Rice millers have agreed to supply 200,000 kilograms of rice daily to the market through the ‘Lanka Sathosa’, at a controlled price effective from today (04).

title: Deadline extended for filing income tax returns
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has extended the deadline for filing Income Tax Returns for the Year of Assessment 2023/2024, offering relief to taxpayers and approved accountants affected by recent severe weather events.

title: CSE’s All Share Price Index records all-time high
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange has reached all-time high today (04), surpassing the previous record set on 19 January 2022.

title: China calls on universities to provide ‘love education’
byline: China is urging colleges and universities to provide “love education” to emphasise positive views on marriage, love, fertility and family, in a bid to boost the country’s flagging birth rate.

title: Hirunika acquitted from contempt of court charges
byline: After concluding the hearing of the petition filed against former Member of Parliament Hirunika Premachandra accusing her of contempt of court, the Appeals Court today ordered to acquit her of those charges.

title: Excise officers raid popular casino in Kollupitiya
byline: The officials of the Excise Department have conducted a raid at a well-known casino located in the Kollupitiya area, for allegedly illegally maintaining liquor counters.

title: Bollywood actress’ sister arrested for double murder in New York
byline: Aliya Fakhri, actress Nargis Fakhri’s sister, was arrested in New York on charges of murdering her ex-boyfriend and his female friend.

title: Suspect arrested over Ahangama double murder
byline: A suspect has been arrested in connection with the murder of an elderly couple inside their home at Welhengoda in the Ahangama police division.

title: Court rejects W.M. Mendis’ petition challenging Excise license suspension
byline: The Court of Appeal has ordered the dismissal of a petition filed by the W.M. Mendis & Co. Limited today (04) without taking it up for hearing.

title: Kerala cannabis worth over Rs. 75 mln seized in Guru Nagar
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has seized around 188 kilograms and 350 grams of Kerala cannabis from a dinghy, during a special search operation conducted in the sea area off Guru Nagar, Jaffna in the wee hours of today (04).

title: W.M. Mendis’ liquor manufacturing license to be suspended
byline: The liquor manufacturing license issued to W.M. Mendis & Co. Limited will be suspended from tomorrow (December 5) due to their failure to pay Rs. 5.7 billion in excise taxes and surcharges, the Excise department said.

title: Government Policy Statement passed in Parliament
byline: The resolution on the statement of the Government Policy, which was presented by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in Parliament on November 21, was passed unanimously in Parliament today (04) without a vote.

title: President Dissanayake engages in discussion with ITAK MPs
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met with Parliamentarians from the Illankai Tamil Arasu Kadchi (ITAK) at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo today (04).

title: CEO of UnitedHealthcare fatally shot in New York City
byline: The head of US insurance company UnitedHealthcare has been shot and killed in New York City, according to the BBC’s US partner CBS News.

title: South Korea’s President faces impeachment after martial law debacle
byline: South Korean lawmakers on Wednesday proposed impeaching President Yoon Suk Yeol for his sudden decision to declare martial law, which he rescinded after a chaotic standoff between parliament and the army that damaged the country’s standing.

title: 244 ‘Mahaviru’ celebrations in North, LTTE symbols displayed at 10
byline: Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs, Ananda Wijepala, informed the Parliament today (04) that out of 244 ‘Mahaviru’ (Maaveerar Naal) commemoration events held in the Northern Province, LTTE-related symbols were displayed at 10 of them.
